args: Thank you...for all the kindness you\nshowed me...this...year! Done!
A very...Happy New Year to you...\nwith best wishes for...the year to come.
Hey, what are you guys up to?\nWriting postcards?
They're not just any postcards.\nThese are called nengajo.
Okay, I'll bite. The heck's a nengajo?
Nope. This another Hinomotoan\nNew Year's tradition?
Yep! We send 'em out early so they arrive\nright at the start of the new year.
You write people you're close to in order\nto thank them for the last year and\nwish them well in the new one.
Well, ain't that wild? We send Dragonyule\ncards here in Alberiaâ€”sounds like that's\nmore or less the same thing.
Pretty much, yeah. It's really fun thinking\nof what to write to everyone on your list.
It also offers a fine opportunity to reflect\non relationships at the close of the year.
Niiice. You guys mind if I give it a go?
Sure! I'm happy to walk you through it.
My buddies better watch out, 'cause I'm\nslinging some spicy nengajo their way!
You're getting good with that brush, Luca!
Are you feeling all right? You look...pale.
Yeah, sure. Fine. I'll sleep as soon as I\nfinish the last one of these.
You haven't slept? But you've been\nwriting those for DAYS!
Yeah, but every time I think about who\nneeds one, the list keeps growing...
And THEN I have to come up with a\npersonalized message for each of them,\nand this ink and brush thing is NOT easy.
Trust me, it's been a spilled-ink tsunami\naround this place lately.
But if I don't put my heart and soul\ninto 'em, what's the point?
Your dedication to your friends\nis really quite remarkable.
And when you have so many, it can be\nquite the undertaking. Well, just lemme\nknow if I can help out, okay?
Now that I've heard your reasons,\nI won't try to stop you!
No, thank YOU! I'm touched to see you so\neager to share in our Hinomotoan culture.
...Little wonder you have such a long list.
Man, if you could prep some ink for me,\nthat'd be a real solid. Oh, and maybe a\nspare brush?
They're in your hands now, Francesca.
Leave it to me! I'll see them delivered\nat once through my network.
Gotta say, though, I don't think I've ever\nseen a stack of postcards this big. You just\nget back from a trip around the world?

Those are called nengajoâ€”Hinomotoans
send 'em as a kind of combo New Year's
greeting and a thank-you for the previous
year.
Well, aren't you quite the expert!
Heh. Yeah, I had good teachers.\nOh, hereâ€”this one's yours.
ï¼‚Thanks for keeping the supplies flowing\nyear-round. Let's make this a good one.ï¼‚
Urk... Little awkward hearing that\nread out loud right in front of me.
And a little awkward to read it! I'm not\nused to being thanked for doing my job.
Guess we don't often take the time to say\nthat kinda stuff even to friends.
And we don't often get to hear it!\n...This is really sweet, Luca. Thank you.
I'll make sure these get delivered so\neveryone has a chance to feel like this.
Can I please just go to bed?
Of course! For as long as you like!
Ha ha! Yeah, but it's a good reminder\nof why he has so many friends.
I feel fortunate to be one of them.
Though if his to-do list of nengajo grows\nwith each new friend he makes...
His New Year's are only going to get\nmore and more brutal as the years go on!
Eh, I'm sure he'll power through.
Heh. Sleep well, Luca. You earned it.
